trans-unit.source:
\n

Collects information relevant to a warning or error returned by SQL Server.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the severity level of the error returned from SQL Server.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx XXX Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A value from 1 to 25 that indicates the severity level of the error.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxx xxxx 0 xx 00 xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The default is 0.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xx 0.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the line number within the Transact-SQL command batch or stored procedure that contains the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx Xxxxxxxx$XXX xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The line number within the Transact-SQL command batch or stored procedure that contains the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx Xxxxxxxx$XXX xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the text describing the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The text describing the error.

For more information on errors generated by SQL Server, see SQL Server Books Online.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx$ xxx XXX Xxxxxx Xxxxx Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a number that identifies the type of error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number that identifies the type of error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the stored procedure or remote procedure call (RPC) that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx $XXX$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The name of the stored procedure or RPC.

For more information on errors generated by SQL Server, see SQL Server Books Online.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx XXX.$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx$ xxx XXX Xxxxxx Xxxxx Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the instance of SQL Server that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the instance of SQL Server.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the provider that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the provider that generated the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Some error messages can be raised at multiple points in the code for the Database Engine.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxx xxx Xxxxxxxx Xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: For example, an 1105 error can be raised for several different conditions.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx$ xx 0000 xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Each specific condition that raises an error assigns a unique state code.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The state code.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the complete text of the error message.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The complete text of the error.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x
